title: Workers spend three hours a week complaining about their job - and also moan about their boss
text:
Workers spend two hours and 45 minutes a week complaining about their job – and another 31 minutes moaning about their boss.

The amount of work and lack of recognition are the most common complaints followed by pay and colleagues.

Checking work emails after hours, last-minute deadlines and an overly demanding manager were the biggest causes of workplace stress.

Constant complaints: Workers moan about their jobs close to three hours a week, along with pay and a lack of recognition

Richard Jenkins, psychologist and spokesman for wellbeing charity CABA, said: 'A level of pressure can actually make us work better.

'However, too much leads to stress.'
description: Workers spend around three hours a week moaning about their place of work. Two hours and 45 minutes is spent complaining about their job and 31 minutes about their boss they admit.
